content: of pearls succulent second row spike stitch is a single_crochet worked around the last row into the second row third row spike stitch is a single_crochet worked around the second to last and first single_crochet 36 stitches row 7 ch1 *3sc scinc 3sc repeat from * around join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet 42 stitches row 8 ch1 single_crochet in each stitch around join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet tie off leaving a long tail for sewing assembly take your dirt and thread the two tails of a leaf strand through the top of it each end about one stitch apart then flip the dirt over to the wrong side and tie the two tails together tightly page 6 elv needleworks ©2022 string of pearls succulent repeat with each leaf strand keeping the majority towards the middle of the dirt and spacing out as desired now it s time to stuff in order to have a stable base i recommend a couple of things one is to cut a circle of plastic or cardboard to fit in the bottom and keep it flat another option is to put weighted beads in the base to help with stability and weight i opted for about ½ of beads on the bottom fill the rest of the pot loosely with polyfil or other stuffing page 7 elv needleworks ©2022 string of pearls succulent sew the dirt into the top of the pot it should be attached into the 26th row of the pot or right where the bottom of your longest spike stitch hits i used a whipstitch being careful not to let the stitching show on the outside of the pot i also recommend folding over the edge of your pot for ease of sewing then flipping it back up when you are done weave in your ends and your string of pearls potted plant is done page 8 elv needleworks ©2022 string of pearls succulent thank you for downloading string of pearls hanging succulent crochet pattern if you have any questions
